business.headline: What is Mutual Fund Lite? All you need to knowThe aim of the Mutual Fund Lite framework is to simplify the rules for managing passively managed mutual funds.
Sensex, Nifty end flat as banking sector downturn offsets IT surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 33.49 points to end at 84,266.29, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 13.95 points to close at 25,796.90.

RVNL shares down 19% from record high. Good time to buy? RVNL shares have corrected nearly 19% from its record high of Rs 647. Is now a good time to invest in RVNL stock, or should investors wait for clearer signals? Read on to know more.

New life insurance rules from today: What it means for you? As of October 1, policyholders will now be eligible for a guaranteed surrender value from the first year, even if they have only paid one annual premium. However, these new regulations are expected to lower returns for policyholders over time.
Explained: Why Paytm shares jumped over 7% todayAt 2:56 pm, shares of Paytm were trading over 7.02% higher at Rs 736.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

This smallcap EV stock is up 38,000% in 5 years. Have you invested? In just a month, the company's shares have gained over 83% and over 168% in a year. In the past five years, the stock has gained a whopping 38,900%.
Who is Tony Vinciquerra, outgoing CEO of Sony Pictures Entertainment?Tony Vinciquerra joined Sony Pictures Entertainment in June 2017 and saw five consecutive years of profit growth
New TDS rates from today: These transactions will be impactedRevised tax rates and TDS changes are now in effect. Here's what taxpayers need to know about the updates.
Who is Ravi Ahuja, the incoming CEO of Sony Pictures?As he steps into the CEO role, Ravi Ahuja will succeed Tony Vinciquerra, who will remain with SPE as a non-executive chairman until December 2025.

Check latest interest rates on PPF, SCSS, SSY and more The post office savings schemes included in this decision are the Public Provident Fund (PPF), Senior Citizen Savings Scheme (SCSS), Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY), and a few others.

Consumers await fuel price relief as OMCs pocket huge gainsDespite falling crude prices and record profits, consumers are still waiting for meaningful reductions in fuel prices, even as oil marketing companies are reaping huge benefits.

Google pays $2.7 billion to bring back AI visionary Noam ShazeerNoam Shazeer, 48, was one of Google's early hires, joining the company in 2000. A talented software engineer, Shazeer made his mark in AI, becoming a key figure in Google's early AI development.

India's factory growth cools to eight-month low in SeptemberNew orders - a key gauge of demand - grew at the weakest pace since December, though were still robust, while output was at an eight-month low.

Diffusion Engineers IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusDiffusion Engineers IPO allotment status: Investors can check their allotment status through the online portals of the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd, the registrar for the IPO.

Gold, silver price today, October 1, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today October 1, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.
Sensex, Nifty open higher as IT and auto stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 147.39 points to 84,447.17 at 10:02 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 34.75 points to trade at 25,845.60.

New PPF rules effective today: All you need to know New PPF rules effective today streamline account management for minors, multiple account holders, and NRIs, impacting interest rates and regulations.

Stock market changes effective today: 3 things investors need to knowThree key updates effective today will impact transaction fees, Securities Transaction Tax, and share buyback taxation for stock market investors.

Bloodbath on D-Street: Sensex slips 1,200 points; investors lose Rs 4 lakh croreThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 1,272.07 points to 84,299.78 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 361.65 points lower at 25,810.85.

Ola Electric shares slip below Rs 100. Buy the dip or avoid? The stock was down 2.59% at Rs 99.55 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), marking a sharp decline from its record high of Rs 157.53 on August 20, 2024.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Mass shooting near Israel's Tel Aviv, terror attack suspected: News agency ReutersMass shooting near Israel's Tel Aviv, terror attack suspected: News agency Reuters

US official says Iran preparing for ballistic missile attack on Israel: Report  Live Updates This statement came after the Israeli military stated that it launched ground operations against the Iran-backed militant organisation Hezbollah in Lebanon on Tuesday, further escalating the conflict after a week of intensive airstrikes that killed hundreds.

Tirupati laddu row: Andhra pauses SIT probe until Supreme Court hearingThe development comes a day after the Supreme Court raised a slew of questions to the Andhra Pradesh government over the Tirupati laddu controversy.

Posing as CBI officials, fake court hearing: How cybercriminals duped SP OswalThe police said the cybercriminals contacted Vardhman Group chairman SP Oswal, claiming to have incriminating documents related to a money laundering case involving him. He was duped into transferring Rs 7 crore to the fraudsters.

How image of boy lying dead in father's lap spurred second Palestinian uprisingThe heart-wrenching incident on September 30, 2000, involving Jamal al-Durrah and his 12-year-old son Muhammad in Gaza, became the defining image of the second Palestinian uprising.

Delivery agent killed by customer in Lucknow, body packed into delivery bagA delivery man was killed by a customer and his body was disposed of in a canal in Lucknow. The main accused, along with his accomplices, packed the agent's body into the same bag in which he had delivered phones.

Fearless and selfless, captain Rohit Sharma inspires India to another famous winIndia vs Bangladesh: Despite losing two-and-a-half days due to rain, India managed to beat Bangladesh with seven wickets and a session to spare. Rohit Sharma has to be given credit for how India batted without the fear of failure on Monday as they raced against time.

US official says Iran preparing for ballistic missile attack on Israel: Report Live Updates This statement came after the Israeli military stated that it launched ground operations against the Iran-backed militant organisation Hezbollah in Lebanon on Tuesday, further escalating the conflict after a week of intensive airstrikes that killed hundreds.

Watch: Russian jet flies within feet of US fighter plane off Alaska coastUS Senator Dan Sullivan said that the actions of the Russian fighter jet put the lives of US airmen at risk. The incident took place during the intercept of Russian jets near Alaska last week.

Krushna Abhishek updates fans on Govinda's health, says why he couldn't visit Comedian Krushna Abhishek reassured fans about the improving health of his uncle, actor Govinda, who was hospitalised following an accidental gunshot.

Rajinikanth had swelling in blood vessel, to be discharged in 2 days: HospitalSuperstar Rajinikanth was admitted to a Chennai hospital on Monday after he complained of stomach pain. The hospital has now released a medical bulletin, mentioning that doctors performed a non-surgical procedure to fix a blood vessel connecting to his heart.

Israel's ground raids in Lebanon, Hezbollah says Mossad targeted in Tel AvivIsrael said it had launched a "limited" ground incursion into Lebanon on Tuesday. In response, Hezbollah said that it had used new Fadi 4 missiles to attack the Tel Aviv headquarters of Israel's Mossad intelligence agency.
Car industry adjusts wholesales in SeptemberWhile Maruti, Hyundai and Tata recorded a decline in their domestic wholesales in September, Mahindra and Kia posted growth.

Jimmy Carter turns 100, becomes first US President to reach the milestoneJimmy Carter turned 100 on Tuesday, becoming the longest-living president in US history. Known for his post-presidential efforts in peace and human rights, Carter continues to inspire despite health challenges and looks forward to voting in the upcoming election.

Top Iranian secret service officer was Israeli spy: Iran ex-president's bombshellFormer Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad revealed in an interview that the head of a secret unit tasked with countering Israel's spy agency Mossad's operations in Iran was, in fact, an Israeli agent.

Heart patient in Kerala dies after treatment by failed 2nd year MBBS studentThe Kerala Police arrested an "unqualified" resident medical officer (RMO) following the death of a 60-year-old heart patient at a private hospital in Kozhikode.

Mahima Chaudhry recalls traumatic accident during Dil Kya Kare shootMahima Chaudhry opened up about an accident during the filming of Dil Kya Kare and how it affected her career and personal life. She shared her struggles and resilience in keeping the incident private for two decades.

Has Siddaramaiah shot himself in the foot?Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's wife, BM Parvathi, wrote to Mysuru Urban Development Authority (Muda) to return 14 plots of land that had sparked a huge controversy. However, the letter to Muda might be counterproductive as it is being showcased by the BJP as an "admission of guilt" in the land scam.

China eyes Western supply chains after Lebanon pager shockThe Chinese side noted that the explosion incident and back-to-back targeted killings triggered serious concerns among consumers in Arab countries about the security of electronic products produced in or whose supply chains are controlled by the West.

Woman bleeds to death after sex, partner arrested for negligenceAccording to the police, the woman went to a hotel with her boyfriend. While the couple were having sex, the woman started bleeding profusely from her private part and became unconscious.

Israeli forces dominate but Hezbollah has ground advantageBeginning with the pager attacks on September 17, a series of Israeli assaults, including remote detonations and airstrikes that eliminated key Hezbollah leaders, culminated in the most shocking airstrike that killed Hezbollah chief Hassan Nasrallah on September 27.
R Ashwin remains tight-lipped over debate of India having designated Test centresRavichandran Ashwin remained tight-lipped over the ongoing debate about if India should have designated Test venues.

Attack on Constitution: Rahul Gandhi on lavish Ambani weddingAddressing a rally in Haryana's Sonipat, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi said that PM Modi has developed a system where 25 people in India can spend thousands of crores of rupees on their marriage, while farmers and ordinary people have to take loans for getting their children married.

Bengaluru Police reacts to viral video of man trying to break into woman's carA Bengaluru woman had a narrow escape when a man tried to break into her car. The police reacted after a video of the incident went viral on social media.

Babygirl trailer: Nicole Kidman stars in a tense erotic thrillerThe trailer for Babygirl, a 2024 erotic thriller starring Nicole Kidman and Harris Dickinson, has been released. The film explored power dynamics and forbidden romance in a corporate setting.

James Dean biopic in works on his alleged romance with writer William BastLate Hollywood icon and actor James Dean's new biopic based on writer William Bast's memoir is in the works. The film will reportedly throw some spotlight on his alleged romance with the author.

Shatrughan Sinha, David Dhawan, Jackky Bhagnani and others visit Govinda in hospitalActor and Shiv Sena leader Govinda was hospitalised in Mumbai on Tuesday after he accidentally shot himself in his leg with his licenced revolver. many celebrities were clicked as they arrived to meet the actor at CritiCare hospital including David Dhawan, Shatrughan Sinha and Jackky Bhagnani.

sports.headline: Tamil Nadu squad for Ranji Trophy: Sai Kishore named captain, Sundar misses outSai Kishore has been named as Tamil Nadu's captain for their 1st match of the Ranji Trophy 2024-25. TNCA announced an 18-member squad as Tamil Nadu face Saurashtra from October 11.

IND vs BAN 2nd Test: India's miraculous victory in Kanpur in numbersIndia completed a sensational victory over Bangladesh in the second Test of the series as they beat them by seven wickets in Kanpur. Here are some remarkable numbers of India's miraculous win.

CSK unsure of retaining MS Dhoni as uncapped player: 'Haven't discussed yet'CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan said that the franchise remained unsure if they want to retain MS Dhoni as an uncapped player, He further revealed that the franchise is yet to hold discussions with Dhoni over the same.

China Open: Jannik Sinner sets up blockbuster final against Carlos AlcarazThe 2024 China Open final will feature Jannik Sinner against Carlos Alcaraz after both players secured semi-final wins. The clash promises an intense battle between two young stars, sharing all four 2024 Grand Slam titles.

Jay Shah as ICC Chairman will take decision on Champions Trophy: Rajeev Shukla BCCI Vice President Rajeev Shukla has revealed that Jay Shah will act as an independent ICC Chairman and will take a decision on India's participation in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 in Pakistan.

Youth Test: Australia's Indian origin Vishwa Ramkumar troubles India U-19Australia's Indian-origin spinner Vishwa Ramkumar stole the spotlight with a four-wicket haul, turning the tide in favor of the visitors. With both teams battling for supremacy, the Youth Test is set for an exciting finish in Chennai.

BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla promises improvement in Kanpur stadium drainageIndia vs Bangladesh, Kanpur Test: BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla said he was happy that the Test match in Kanpur produced a result despite rain washing away nearly three days of action. India raced against time to pull off a 'miraculous' victory on Tuesday. Shukla said he has already spoken to the government about improving the facilities at Green Park, including its drainage.

Tushar Deshpande eyes 'strong comeback' after successful ankle surgeryIndia pacer Tushar Deshpande successfully underwent ankle surgery in London and expressed eagerness to return to action. After an impressive IPL 2024 season, he missed the Duleep Trophy and remains uncertain for Mumbai's Ranji Trophy opener.

India inch closer to World Test Championship final berth after Bangladesh winThe Indian team further solidified their position at the top of the World Test Championship standings. They won the series 2-0 against Bangladesh with a 7-wicket win in Kanpur.

Irani Cup: Rahane, Sarfaraz star for Mumbai on hard-fought opening dayIrani Cup 2024: Ajinkya Rahane, Shreyas Iyer and Sarfaraz Khan hit fifties as Mumbai recovered from early trouble to head to Stumps at 237 for 4. Captain Rahane will be looking to make it big and start the domestic season on a high.

Olympic medallist Manu Bhaker to visit Kolkata during Durga Puja 2024Olympic medallist Manu Bhaker is set to experience the grandeur of Durga Puja in Kolkata for the first time since her historic Paris 2024 campaign. The star shooter will also inspire young athletes and promote women's empowerment during her visit.

'Upcoming all-rounder' Akash Deep reveals banter with Virat Kohli over his batAkash Deep revealed his dun banter with Virat Kohli as the star player gifted his bat to the bowler. Abhishek Nayar also hailed Akash Deep as the upcoming all-rounder.

R Ashwin not targeting 600-wicket milestone, wants to take it '1 Test at a time'Star India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has revealed that he isn't targeting the milestone of 600 Test wickets after another match winning performance against Bangladesh at Green Park, Kanpur.

Watch: Kohli gifts special bat to Shakib al Hasan after Kanpur TestVirat Kohli honored Shakib Al Hasan by gifting him a signed bat after the Kanpur Test, marking what could be Shakib's final Test match. The gesture symbolized respect for Shakib's iconic all-round career.

Ready for 100-all out: Rohit Sharma explains India's Bazball show in Kanpur TestIndia vs Bangladesh: Captain Rohit Sharma said India were prepared to get bowled out for 100 in their first innings as the focus was on scoring quickly and racing against time to produce a favourable result. Despite losing two days to wet weather, India won the Test by seven wickets and a session to spare.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
